articles.title: 'It will make us stronger': Pep lists VAR grievances amid Carabao Cup controversy
articles.summary: Pep Guardiola unleashed an extraordinary takedown of previous VAR calls that have gone against Manchester City following Antoine Semenyo's controversial disallowed goal in their Carabo Cup semi-final first-leg win at Newcastle.

articles.title: 'Body blow' - Man City on brink of Carabao Cup final with win at Newcastle
articles.summary: Antoine Semenyo made it two from two for new club Manchester City as they took hold of their Carabao Cup semi-final with a 2-0 first-leg win at Newcastle - but saw Pep Guardiola embark on a four-minute takedown of VAR after the winger was denied another goal.

articles.title: QUIZ: Man Utd's post-Fergie managerial saga - how much do you know?
articles.summary: Michael Carrick is on his way back to Old Trafford in an interim capacity, becoming Manchester United's 11th change of manager or head coach since Sir Alex Ferguson's retirement in 2013.

articles.title: ‘VAR delay made us stronger’: Guardiola hails City after disallowed Semenyo goal
articles.summary: ‘I think my players were angry. The spirit was there’Newcastle beaten 2-0 in Carabao Cup semi-final first-legPep Guardiola’s evident delight at Manchester City’s 2-0 win at Newcastle in the first leg of their Carabao Cup semi-final was tempered by the lengthy video assistant referee delay that disallowed what would have been Antoine Semenyo’s second goal of the game.It prompted Manchester City’s manager to launch into an epic, and often incomprehensible, rant about VAR and its perceived failings
articles.author: Louise Taylor

articles.title: Liam Rosenior to hold talks with Sterling and Disasi over Chelsea futures

articles.author: Jacob Steinberg

Arteta spoke after ­revealing that William Saliba is a doubt for the first leg of the Carabao Cup semi-final against Chelsea on Wednesday.Saliba and Leandro Trossard did not feature in the FA Cup victory against Portsmouth on Sunday. articles.title: Furious Pep Guardiola launches astonishing VAR rant - and drags up Dean Henderson's FA Cup final lifeline AND two previous calls at Newcastle - after six-minute delay marred Man City's Carabao Cup semi-final victory

articles.title: City defeat a reminder Newcastle have entered a level where it’s eat or be eaten | Andy Brassell
articles.summary: In terms of cold, hard silverware, domestic cups might be as good as it gets after Carabao Cup semi-final first-leg lossThere is nothing quite like the first time. Or the first time in living memory, at least. Of all the strides taken by Newcastle since the Saudi takeover in 2021, the Carabao Cup will always be the stop on the road sprinkled with the most magic. Champions League football is more than nice, the return of adventure to following this club appreciated as much as the swelling of the

articles.title: The day 'everybody nearly scored' for Arsenal
articles.summary: It has been 20 years since Arsenal had a field day at Highbury and knocked seven goals past Steve McClaren's 10-man Middlesbrough, equalling their biggest Premier League win.  Thierry Henry also bagged a hat-trick to equal Cliff Bastin's record of 150 league goals for the Gunners, completing a perfect afternoon for Arsene Wenger's side in front of 38,186 fans.  There were five different names on the scoresheet, with Henry opening the floodgates after 20 minutes with a superb volley.

articles.author: Catalina Bush
